name: @spectree/pixel
description: Design-to-code pipeline that converts Figma designs into pixel-perfect implementations, then iteratively reviews and fixes until 99% fidelity match

agents.name: pd-orchestrator
agents.description: Entry-point agent that chains all sub-agents and manages the fix-validation loop (max 3 rounds) from Figma link to pixel-perfect code

agents.name: pd-figma-extractor
agents.description: Extracts exact design specs from Figma node tree via MCP tools including colors, typography, spacing, dimensions, borders, shadows, and layout

agents.name: pd-component-scout
agents.description: Scans codebase to identify reusable components, design tokens, and layout patterns for optimal code reuse

agents.name: pd-screenshot-comparator
agents.description: Captures implementation screenshots via Playwright and compares pixel-by-pixel against Figma reference using pixelmatch

agents.name: pd-diff-analyzer
agents.description: Identifies exactly which elements and CSS properties differ from design, produces prioritized fix list ordered by visual impact

agents.name: pd-fixer
agents.description: Applies surgical SCSS/HTML changes using design tokens to bring implementation within 1% of design spec

agents.name: pd-standards-enforcer
agents.description: Audits code changes for compliance with project coding standards including BEM naming, token usage, and no hardcoded values

agents.name: pd-validator
agents.description: Re-runs screenshot comparison after fixes, determines PASS/FAIL, and manages iteration loop with trend tracking

skills.name: design-extraction
skills.description: 8-step pipeline process from Figma link input to CI-locked pixel-perfect implementation

skills.name: coding-standards
skills.description: Component structure standards including BEM naming, CSS variable usage, no @use imports, and Angular patterns

instructions.name: pixel-thresholds
instructions.description: Global diff threshold configuration (1% max) with scene-specific override support

instructions.name: pixel-viewports
instructions.description: Viewport presets for screenshot capture including desktop, tablet, and mobile dimensions

instructions.name: pixel-config
instructions.description: Project-specific configuration including framework, dev server, color tokens, and radius tokens
